page.title: 04PICTON VILLAGE
page.content: Picton is a small,peaceful village in the country.It is well spaced out,first comes the signal box and a railway line which has a level crossing.The old sidings have been converted into a pinewood factory. Opposite to this is'The Station Hotel' This was built to provide liquid refreshment for the brickworkers and accommodation for travellers disembarking at the busy Picton Junction in days gone by.St.Hilary's church is on the way to the main Picton village.The latter is a ribbon development consisting only of houses and two farms.There is a telephone, postbox and a twice daily bus service. For everything else Picton is dependent on neighbouring towns and villages.There are 56 __ houses with a population of approximately 168.___.
